item.title: 3 new sculptures chosen for Yountville Art Walk
item.description:
3 new sculptures chosen for Yountville Art Walk

More than three dozen artworks on display in downtown Yountville may soon gain company. Three installations from Florida, Texas and Canada have gained the blessing of the Upvalley resort town's Arts Commission to be shown as part of the Yountville Art Walk.

item.title: BottleRock, Napa Valley: A guide to the best places to stay
item.description:
BottleRock, Napa Valley: A guide to the best places to stay

BottleRock is comprised of three days of live music and some of the best wine from Napa and Sonoma accompanied by Napa's biggest names in food. Where you stay matters NAPA, Calif., May 4, 2016 - BottleRock Napa Valley, three days of live music on four stages with some of the best wine from Napa and Sonoma accompanied by Napa's biggest names in food, is only a few weeks away.

item.title: Driving the Second-Generation Audi Q7 in Napa Valley
item.description:
Driving the Second-Generation Audi Q7 in Napa Valley

Audi's entry into the SUV market came late in the game: Unveiled at the Frankfurt auto show in 2005, the Q7 followed the trail blazed by the likes of BMW, Cadillac, and Range Rover. Now, in 2016, Audi gains a serious leg up on the competition.

item.title: Don't Lose Your Head! Pre-Revolutionary Cognac on Sale in France
item.description:
Don't Lose Your Head! Pre-Revolutionary Cognac on Sale in France

If you want a taste of France when Marie Antoinette was still on the throne and don't have a time machine, you're in luck. On May 9, one of Paris's oldest and most famous restaurants La Tour d'Argent will auction off about 100 rare spirits and liquors, including a lot of cognac predating the French Revolution.

item.title: The Little Woody Barrel-Aged Beer, Cider and Whiskey Festival To Take Place Eugene
item.description:
The Little Woody Barrel-Aged Beer, Cider and Whiskey Festival To Take Place Eugene

This coming fall the folks at Lay It Out Events will take its traveling The Little Woody Barrel-Aged Beer, Cider and Whiskey Festival to Eugene, Oregon. The barrel-aged beer fest that originated in Bend has been taken on the road to towns such as Medford and Boise, Idaho and even made a onetime appearance here in Portland.

item.title: Musician David Gibbs Is Letting You Drink His Rare Wine Collection, One Glass at a Time
item.description:
Musician David Gibbs Is Letting You Drink His Rare Wine Collection, One Glass at a Time

David Gibbs swirls an inky '91 cabernet sauvignon in his glass, then brings it to his nose for a sniff. "Give it a little air," he advises. "It's super brambly and rustic." The co-owner of Augustine in Sherman Oaks tastes wine like a pro but doesn't look the part. Lanky...

item.title: Italians, forget the French!
item.description:
Italians, forget the French!

A slightly shorter version of this article is published by the Financial Times. The mainstream press love a wine spat and probably made more than was necessary about the Italian premier Matteo Renzi's recent boast, supposedly countered by François Hollande, that Italian wine is now superior to France's, but what is the truth?

item.title: Stoli® Vodka Goes Gluten Free
item.description:
Stoli® Vodka Goes Gluten Free

The first-of-its-kind gluten-free vodka blend of corn and buckwheat results in an ideal taste with a smooth and clean finish that was given an 'exceptional' 92-point rating by the Beverage Testing Institute (BTI), the leading authority in independent spirits reviews.

item.title: Sonoma's Top Wine Growers Gathered to Raise Over $690,000 at the Sonoma Barrel Auction
item.description:
Sonoma's Top Wine Growers Gathered to Raise Over $690,000 at the Sonoma Barrel Auction

The 2nd Annual Sonoma County Barrel Auction opened to much success and closed out with the same amount of applause. Raising $693,800 with 75 unique wine lots... Not too shabby. Let's go back to where it all started...
